timeline.message:
Some bug fixes:
- Fixed problems on dispose, restart and configuration changing
- Fixed a lot of warnings
- Fixed the number of decimal places to one

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

Added @NonNullByDefault to all interfaces and removed warnings

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

Fixed problems with program switches

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

Fixed fraction problems on numbers

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

Disabled log entry

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

Fixed sending of data

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: I suggest making valPara a StringBuilder instance instead since you do a lot of concatenation with it.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Would it be possible to make type an enum instead of a string?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I added constants for the different types. I cannot use enum because it cannot be used in switch/case.
replies.author: Markinus

replies.bodyText: But enum can be used in switch/case... it is one of the primary benefits of using an enum.
replies.author: cpmeister
Markinus

replies.bodyText: That is fine for me. An enum type would be better but a constant works as well.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: This method should exit early if necessary logging levels are not enabled.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Instead of getting the httpClient reference through the set/unset methods you should instead have the HttpClientFactory passed in through the KM200HandlerFactory constructor; that way you can make the httpClient field non-null and final.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Do you maybe have an example you to do this? I'm not sure about the interface to the constructor of KM200HandlerFactory instead of the reference anotation to set/unset. How can I modify the call to the modified constructor? Usually the system is searching fo a constructor with 0 arguments. Is there a different annotation type for this case? Sorry, I don't know how to do this..
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: same here
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: and here, you get the idea. Please update all other methods similarly.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: The error logging level should be reserved for issues catastrophic enough to threaten the operation of openHab itself. In error in a binding shouldn't qualify for this. Please read the openHab coding guidelines for expected use of logging in bindings.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Ok, I will take a closer look to it.
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.bodyText: same here
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: don't log error
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Should probably make all these string literals constants
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I changed it. It is using now constants from the CoreItemFactory class.
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.message:
Added constants for data types
Using constants for item types
Small changes and bugfixes

Signed-off-by: Markus Eckhardt <github@familie-eckhardt.eu>

Added constants for data types
Using constants for item types
Small changes and bugfixes

Changed the httpClientFactory interface from set/uset to constructor.

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: You can get this one in the constructor too
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I tested both for this binding in the past. The threadpool solution was better for this case. I will add the prefix.
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.bodyText: see above
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: please remove all the blank lines after your break statements.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Why is a static field getting populated by a constructor? Please do this in a static{...} block instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Ohh, yes, you're right. I fixed it.
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.bodyText: Once you make the KM200ChannelTypeProvider non-null and final in the ThingHandlerFactory then you should be able to make the non-null again.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Please don't log as error
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I rechecked all log entries now.
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.bodyText: don't log as error
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: here too
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Why are you sleeping in a synchronized block? Or better question, why do you need to sleep the thread?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: The device needs a bit time to recover.
replies.author: Markinus

timeline.bodyText: don't log as error
